Content: Problem with kmd is that ppl dont seem to care about it.. Tech gets done and works but theres no adoption happening, its not enough with finding devs to build on it u need to find interest from ppl to actually invest and trade it and bring liquidity

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: you mean like with atomicDEX?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it takes a lot of effort to make a showcase, so we focus on one at a time. the good news is that there is a big pipeline of things that can be showcased

Author: Markus#5464

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: without an actually working system, people will just say "thats just a video and not actually working"

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the scope of what we already have working at the blockchain level seems to just be too hard for most people to believe. cli apparently isnt enough unless you are some famous twitter personality

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so we will make a working showcase, serially, and after the second (or third) one, maybe the market will realize that we can actually deliver mass market end user solutions and then we can get more resources to work in parallel.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the USDK will create the ability to lock KMD in an interest free loan to issue stable coins, that can then be used in atomicDEX (without ETH gas)

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so here and there the KMD is ending up needed for the key functionality, even though people are not forced to use it for everything

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: @Markus i think one aspect you need to understand is that atomicDEX is what enables a lot of other things, like having a USDK stablecoin without atomicDEX in high volume usage... it wont really have much effect. in conjunction with a high volume atomicDEX, then we get a stablecoin that is a normal BTC protocol that costs 0.01 USD per transaction.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: even the bitmex CC, without atomicDEX to be able to swap into and out of the BET coin, it ends up isolated. the way i see it is that atomicDEX joins otherwise separated technical solutions, into a single integrated solution. the integration is at the financial low friction atomic swap level, but that is sufficient
